poem:
**The Unfamiliar Bull**

In the city's iron maze,  
a beast of ancient pasture  
breaks through with primal grace.  
Pavements tremble beneath  
hooves that once knew moorland's  
soft embrace, now echoing  
in Birmingham. Steel eyes stare,  
questioning the flesh made bronze;  
life blossoming unexpected,  
breathing rumors into  
the heart of our haunt.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Bull spotted running loose around streets of Birmingham Pedestrians in Birmingham were left questioning whether the statue guarding the Bullring shopping centre had come to life when a bull was spotted running loose on the city’s streets. Video footage shared online on Friday morning showed a large black bull with white horns charging around streets in east Birmingham. The bull could be seen galloping past cars on a road near a roundabout and running along". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Bull spotted running loose around streets of Birmingham Pedestrians in Birmingham were left questioning whether the statue guarding the Bullring shopping centre had come to life when a bull was spotted running loose on the city’s streets. The bull could be seen galloping past cars on a road near a roundabout and running along
